name: AWS Security Groups allow internet traffic from internet to FTP-Data port (20)
description: This policy identifies the security groups which are exposing FTP-Data port (20) to the internet. It is recommended that Global permission to access the well known services FTP-Data port (20) should not be allowed in a security group.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name='aws-ec2-describe-security-groups' AND json.rule = (((ipPermissions[?(@.toPort > 20 && @.fromPort < 20)].ipRanges[*] contains 0.0.0.0/0) or (ipPermissions[?(@.toPort == 20 || @.fromPort == 20)].ipRanges[*] contains 0.0.0.0/0)) or ((ipPermissions[?(@.toPort > 20 && @.fromPort < 20)].ipv6Ranges[*].cidrIpv6 contains ::/0) or (ipPermissions[?(@.toPort == 20 || @.fromPort == 20)].ipv6Ranges[*].cidrIpv6 contains ::/0))) and isShared is false
recommendation:
If the Security Groups reported indeed need to restrict all traffic, follow the instructions below:

1. Login to the AWS Console and navigate to the 'VPC' service
2. Select the 'Security Group' reported in the alert. Click on the 'Inbound Rule'
3. Remove the rule which has 'Source' value as 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 and 'Port Range' value as 20 (or range containing 20)
